bill_title: to revise the definition of domestic water use for certain hog farm operations.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the definition of domestic water use for certain hog farm operations. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That subdivision (7) of § 46-1-6 be amended to read as follows: (7) "Domestic use," use of water not exceeding eighteen gallons per minute on an average daily basis, except for larger domestic wells in operation before July 1, 1983, by an individual, or by a family unit or household, for drinking, washing, sanitary, and culinary purposes and other ordinary household purposes; irrigation of a noncommercial family garden, trees, shrubbery, or orchard not greater in area than one acre; eighteen gallons per minute or less for uses in schools, parks, and other public recreation areas; geothermal heat for a single household; or noncommercial on-farm alcohol production. The use of water supplied by a water distribution system for the preceding purposes, for the occupants of schools, hospitals, and other custodial care facilities and for fire protection is a domestic use as against appropriative rights having a priority after June 30, 1978. Stock watering is a domestic use , except that for any operation for the breeding, farrowing, feeding, or raising of swine that requires a general permit from the Department of Environment and Natural Resources, the use of water not exceeding twelve gallons per minute on an average daily basis is a domestic use, and any such use of water in excess of that amount is not a domestic use . Use of groundwater by water distribution systems, except for irrigation purposes is a domestic use except where groundwater and water in flowing streams constitute the same water supply source, but only to the extent the water was actually used before July 1, 1978;
